posts.post_content:
Easy awesome combo:  
  
Turn 1: [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp) + [Blood Celebrant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Celebrant)   
Turn 2: Any other land (Probably Swamp) + [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) + [Culling the Weak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling the Weak) (Blood Celebrant) + This (You have 1 extra Mana)  
Turn 3: If opponent controls creatures, give [fear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fear) or [Dragon Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Shadow)  
Turn 4: Win! (Discard [Draco](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Draco), [Autochton Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Autochton Wurm), or [Gleemax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gleemax).)
posts.html:
Easy awesome combo:

Turn 1: Swamp + Blood Celebrant
Turn 2: Any other land (Probably Swamp) + Dark Ritual + Culling the Weak (Blood Celebrant) + This (You have 1 extra Mana)
Turn 3: If opponent controls creatures, give fear or Dragon Shadow
Turn 4: Win! (Discard Draco, Autochton Wurm, or Gleemax.)

posts.post_content:
My favorite black creature and Magic storyline character.  
  
He one hits with [Draco](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Draco) and [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn), but works well with any big creature and recur-able necromancy ([Phyrexian Reclamation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Reclamation), [Revive the Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Revive the Fallen), and appropriately [Volrath's Stronghold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volrath's Stronghold)).   
  
Feed him a [Filth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Filth) with an [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) on the field. [Shizo, Death's Storehouse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shizo, Death's Storehouse) works very well with him, as does [Rime Transfusion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rime Transfusion) and [Dauthi Embrace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dauthi Embrace).  
  
Once you've pumped him up and attacked don't be afraid to [Rite of Consumption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Consumption) him.
posts.html:
My favorite black creature and Magic storyline character.

He one hits with Draco and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, but works well with any big creature and recur-able necromancy (Phyrexian Reclamation, Revive the Fallen, and appropriately Volrath's Stronghold).

Feed him a Filth with an Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth on the field. Shizo, Death's Storehouse works very well with him, as does Rime Transfusion and Dauthi Embrace.

Once you've pumped him up and attacked don't be afraid to Rite of Consumption him.

Posted By: Paolino (2/27/2012 7:51:39 AM)

posts.post_content:
An amazing reanimation support card. Unlike [Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp), doing the effect multiple times is actually beneficial.   
  
[Putrid Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrid Imp) is still better, since the effect is free, and the Imp has 1 CMC instead of 6.  
  
That being said, Volrath may win the game for you by himself while Putrid Imp is just solely support. I guess if your opponent let by a 1/1 flyer every time it attacked (and then a 2/2 when you have threshold) then it'd win, but that's a lot less likely than a pump-able 6/4.
posts.html:
An amazing reanimation support card. Unlike Putrid Imp, doing the effect multiple times is actually beneficial.

Putrid Imp is still better, since the effect is free, and the Imp has 1 CMC instead of 6.

That being said, Volrath may win the game for you by himself while Putrid Imp is just solely support. I guess if your opponent let by a 1/1 flyer every time it attacked (and then a 2/2 when you have threshold) then it'd win, but that's a lot less likely than a pump-able 6/4.
